Posts.Content: I just had the open surgery to remove my prostate and four lymph nodes on August 21st, my gleason was a 3+3 = 6. I had a postive biopsy for one core. I got the post surgery pathology report today and there were no indications that the cancer spread out of my prostate so it looks like the surgeon got all the cancer. I don't have the experience of many of the posters here, but I know I am happy that I had the surgery as prostate cancer took my father and both my first cousins. It is too early for me to tell if I have the negative side effects possible with the surgery, but I can tell you this, getting rid of the cancer was my priority and I will be alive to deal with any consequences and I will deal with those if necessary, but I will be alive.
Posts.Signature: Dave Las Vegas NV BPH Diagnosed 03/11 DRE Neg 05/11 PSA 03/11 2.1, 05/12 3.2, 06/12 2.8 Biopsy 06/28/12 Gleason 6 (3+3) 15% involvement in one core by invasive adenocarcinoma Rad Retropubic Prostatectomy w/ PLND 08/21/12
Posts.Title: Surgery scheduled Scared to death - help

Posts.Content: One thing to consider at your age on radiation, is what the radiation oncologist I consulted told me. He said at age 60 it would be expected for me to live another 20 years and that radiation can cause cancer about 15 years out from the treatment so I decided to have the surgery and I had it on August 21st the old fashioned way - open surgery since my surgeon had done over 1,000 open prostatectomies. I got the post op pathology report today and my cancer was confined to prostate so I am basically cured and that is what I was looking for in my treatment. I agree that you need to get an experienced surgeon or radiologist and I would ask the radiologist of his opinion about possible cancer from radiation treatment for a younger man.
Posts.Signature: Dave Las Vegas NV BPH Diagnosed 03/11 DRE Neg 05/11 PSA 03/11 2.1, 05/12 3.2, 06/12 2.8 Biopsy 06/28/12 Gleason 6 (3+3) 15% involvement in one core by invasive adenocarcinoma Rad Retropubic Prostatectomy w/ PLND 08/21/12

Posts.Content: I am getting off the aspirin I take every day today, the urologist's list didn't mention the fish oil, so I will stop taking that today also. Thaks for the info.
Posts.Signature: Dave Las Vegas NV BPH Diagnosed 03/11 DRE Neg 05/11 PSA 03/11 2.1, 05/12 3.2, 06/12 2.8 Biopsy 06/28/12 Gleason 6 (3+3) 15% involvement in one core by invasive adenocarcinoma Rad Retropubic Prostatectomy w/ PLND 08/21/12
Posts.Title: Getting Biopsy in Two Weeks

Posts.Content: I posted in another thread a couple of weeks ago when my Urologist recommended a biopsy after my PSA rose from 2.5 to 3.2 in 6 months. I will be 60 on the 26th and have been diagnosed with BPH for about a year and a half and have been getting PSAs every 6 months since then. I have been taking Rapaflo for the BPH since the diagnosis also. I have a history of PC in my family, my father and two paternal first cousins had it. My father lived with it for a little over 9 years after diagnosis at an advanced stage. My older cousin decided to have the prostate removed and did not recover from the surgery, my other cousin recently passed in the hospice since he had an aggressive PC. I am being put on Cipro for three days starting the day before the biopsy, will be given an antibiotic shot after the biopsy is done and the doc is going to use a local. I get the biopsy on June 28th (the day before I retire) and will get the results on July 5th. Looking for moral support at this point. You guys provide alot of good information on this forum that helps us newbies get prepared. Thanks.
Posts.Signature: Dave Las Vegas NV BPH Diagnosed 03/11 DRE Neg 05/11 PSA 03/11 2.1, 05/12 3.2, 06/12 2.8 Biopsy 06/28/12 Gleason 6 (3+3) 15% involvement in one core by invasive adenocarcinoma Rad Retropubic Prostatectomy w/ PLND 08/21/12

Posts.Title: Getting Biopsy in Two Weeks

Posts.Content: Just got back from the urologist and getting my biopsy, now I just have to wait until July 5th to get the results. My urologist is participating in testing for a new PCa screening through urine tests which I volunteered to participate in. So I gave a urine specimum to the nurse from the testing and will give another one in 12 weeks. The biopsy was not bad, uncomfortable, not much pain. The urologist did use a local.
